courses.course_desc: This course offers a survey of Chinese and Taiwanese literature and film in the Chinese language since the beginning of the 20th century. Readings include poems, short stories, and essays in styles as varied as revolutionary, romantic, modernist, nativist, popular, and experimental. Major themes of discussion include tradition and modernity, masculinity and femininity, elite and popular, individual and national identities, class consciousness, and tensions between Chinese and Western culture. This course is taught in Chinese. Written texts are level-appropriate excerpts or abridged editions of original works. Films are shown in Chinese with English subtitles. The course includes a service-learning component. Prerequisite: CHI 3302 or CHI 3303 either with a grade of "D" or better.
